Phelps, back in action after a six-month suspension imposed by USA swimming following his drink driving conviction last September, won the race in Mesa with a time of 52.38 seconds, edging out Ryan Lochte. Phelps, the most decorated Olympian in history, will miss this summer's world championships in Kazan, Russia, following discussions with USA swimming.

edit: Researchers at Natural History Museum in London and University College London have found evidence that human bones found in Gough's Cave in Somerset had the flesh cut from them before being chewed and crushed. They found tooth marks on many of bones, which were discovered in the cave. Archaeologists believe the human remains mixed with occupation waste at sites. Experts believe people living in the late Ice Age indulged in ritual cannibalism, perhaps as a macabre way to revere their dead kin.
reference: Human bones found at Gough's Cave in Cheddar Gorge, Somerset, bore cuts and bite marks proving the people there engaged in ritual cannibalism. The remains have been found to be 00,000 years ago and belonged to prehistoric modern human hunter-gatherers known as the Magdalenians. Skulls found in the cave also had been cut and shaped into bowls and cups. Researchers at the Natural History Museum in London believe cannibalism may have been regular part of disposing of dead relatives at the time.

edit: Retired Lt Col Richard 'Dick Cole gave the medal to the museum's director in a ceremony at the National Museum of the US Air Force on Saturday, 73 years to the day after their daring bombing attack on Japan rallied Americans in World War II. The Medal, which was awarded by Congress earlier in the week, arrived in a ceremonial b-25 flight. Cole, a Dayton native, was mission leader and James' Jimmy 'doolittle's co-pilot for the b-25 bombers attack less than five months after the attack on Pearl Harbor.

edit: Diet Pepsi will no longer contain aspartame due to customer fears over its safety concerns about artificial sweeteners. The sweetener has been linked to a range of health problems, but research has shown it to be safe. It is also used in fizzy drinks and diet drinks in the US. edit: Many people are taking extreme measures to conserve water in the face of the state's historic drought. One has even installed a hybrid sink-toilet in response to the water crisis. Water comes in through the faucet and then fills the tank, and it can then be used to wash hands. Afterwards, the water flows into the toilet.
reference: California is experiencing one of its most extreme droughts in modern history, forcing concerned residents to react with extreme measures. edit: The BBC is going to air a two-hour, real-time documentary following a canal boat.  It will use the same specialist high-definition equipment that was used to shoot the action-packed James Bond blockbuster Skyfall. The corporation hopes many viewers will find it a refreshing change from the usual frenetic pace of modern tv. There is no presenter, narrator, dialogue or music, so all viewers will hear are the sounds of the boat's engine, the lapping of the water, and the local birdsong as the barge makes its way.

edit: New report reveals Russian hackers hacked into the White House computer system. CNN says it's not a new attack on the State Department's network. It is classified information on the White House and Secret Service. The hackers were able to access real-time, non-public schedule of president Obama, which is regarded as highly sensitive information.

Cyber-bandits took over a State Department email account and sent phishing email containing malware to White House. Six-month probe reportedly uncovered evidence pointing to hackers working on behalf of Kremlin.

edit: Eight-week-old puppies were found in a sealed box on April ▃. They were found by a woman who said the dogs were covered in urine and suffering from heat exhaustion. The dogs have worms and are malnourished, and it is likely they have lived their entire lives in a cage. They will be put up for adoption. An animal service officer investigating the case said they have dozens of leads to the arrest and conviction of the person or people responsible for the incident.

The labradors were taken to McKamey Animal Center for treatment which said the animals have worms and are malnourished. It also said it is likely dogs have been neglected over an extended period of time due to their poor condition. Since beginning treatment, they have been flourishing and will be put up for adoption once treatment is complete.

edit: Greenstone acts like a beacon, or booster, to help messages to people in close proximity that are in Bluetooth or Wi-Fi range-up to around ▃ feet (▃ metres). It takes advantage of a feature in Apples iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework (mcf). The app lets you send messages and photos even when a person has no signal by creating a wireless mesh network that connects phones to each other. It allows people to send messages to users to avoid snooping.
